item.title: Visual-Inertial Relative Pose Estimation for Quadrotor Landing
item.description: Summer project where I began developing a quadrotor capable of autonomously flying to a target location and landing based on visual-inertial navigation

item.title: Hierarchical Trajectory Planning for Quadrotor Flight in Unknown Environments
item.description: We implemented FASTER. Did some studies on opt problem formulation These were the test cases These were the results Very basic page just to test how an embedded video might appear.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi, I’m Matt. I’m an autonomy engineer and I like to do fun stuff. This is a little bit about my background. These are some things I’d like to do in the future Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content.
Hugo is one of the most popular open-source static site generators. With its amazing speed and flexibility, Hugo makes building websites fun again.
